data.title: Sweep the &$..%*.# Floor
data.solution:
import sys
import math

# Auto-generated code below aims at helping you parse
# the standard input according to the problem statement.

n = int(input())
for i in range(n):
    s = input()
    c = s.count('.')//2
    print(c*'.')
data.statement:
There's a mess of ascii characters on the floor. Your broom is great at picking up all characters except for periods (.) which are so small that your broom leaves half of them behind (rounded down to nearest integer, i.e. "floor" division). 

Sweep the floor, then output what remains.

data.stubGenerator:
read n:int
loop n read s:string(100)
write ...
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> An integer [[n]] for the number of rows
<<Next [[n]] lines:>> A string [[s]] of all the characters on each row of the floor to be swept up
data.outputDescription: [[n]] lines with the result of each line after sweeping

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

There's a mess of ascii characters on the floor. Your broom is great at picking up all characters except for periods (.) which are so small that your broom leaves half of them behind (rounded down to nearest integer, i.e. "floor" division).

Sweep the floor, then output what remains.
Input
Line 1: An integer n for the number of rows
Next n lines: A string s of all the characters on each row of the floor to be swept up
Output
n lines with the result of each line after sweeping
Constraints
2 <= n <= 50
Example
Input
6
.... ;..... 
k)M a ?jz.nP
-. ..'@^.!W^
 .].....z.V.
Ij>g w. .cr#
   ,v..{.2l.
Output
....

..
....
.
..
